From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Catalan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin accumulāre (“accumulate”).

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central, Balearic) [ə.ku.muˈla]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [a.ku.muˈlaɾ]
  • Audio (Barcelona):(file)

Verb

[edit]

acumular (first-person singular present acumulo, first-person singular preterite acumulí, past participle acumulat)

  1. (transitive) to accumulate (to heap up in a mass)
  2. (reflexive) to accumulate (to grow in number or volume)

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of acumular (first conjugation)
infinitive acumular
gerund acumulant
past participle masculine feminine
singular acumulat acumulada
plural acumulats acumulades

first second third first second third

preterite acumulí acumulares acumulà acumulàrem acumulàreu acumularen
conditional acumularia acumularies acumularia acumularíem acumularíeu acumularien

imperative — tu vostè nosaltres vosaltres
vós 		vostès
affirmative — acumula acumuli acumulem acumuleu acumulin
negative (no) — no acumulis no acumuli no acumulem no acumuleu no acumulin

Derived terms

[edit]
  • acumulable
  • acumulació
  • acumulador
  • acumulament
  • acumulatiu

Related terms

[edit]
  • cúmul

Further reading

[edit]
  • “acumular” in Diccionari català-valencià-balear, Antoni Maria Alcover and Francesc de Borja Moll, 1962.
  • “acumular” in Diccionari normatiu valencià, Acadèmia Valenciana de la Llengua.
  • “acumular”, in Gran Diccionari de la Llengua Catalana, Grup Enciclopèdia Catalana, 2025
  • “acumular”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007

Galician

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

(This etymology is missing or incomplete. Please add to it, or discuss it at the Etymology scriptorium.)

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /akumuˈlaɾ/ [ɑ.ku.muˈlaɾ]
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Hyphenation: a‧cu‧mu‧lar

Verb

[edit]

acumular (first-person singular present acumulo, first-person singular preterite acumulei, past participle acumulado)

  1. to accumulate

Portuguese

[edit]

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • accumular (pre-standardization spelling)

Etymology

[edit]

Learned borrowing from Latin accumulāre (“accumulate”).

Pronunciation

[edit]
 
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /a.ku.muˈla(ʁ)/ [a.ku.muˈla(h)]
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /a.ku.muˈla(ʁ)/ [a.ku.muˈla(h)]
    • (São Paulo) IPA(key): /a.ku.muˈla(ɾ)/
    • (Rio de Janeiro) IPA(key): /a.ku.muˈla(ʁ)/ [a.ku.muˈla(χ)]
    • (Southern Brazil) IPA(key): /a.ku.muˈla(ɻ)/
 
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /ɐ.ku.muˈlaɾ/
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /ɐ.ku.muˈlaɾ/
    • (Southern Portugal) IPA(key): /ɐ.ku.muˈla.ɾi/

  • Audio (Brazil (Caipira)):(file)
  • Hyphenation: a‧cu‧mu‧lar

Verb

[edit]

acumular (first-person singular present acumulo, first-person singular preterite acumulei, past participle acumulado)

  1. to accumulate (to grow in number)
    Synonyms: juntar, armazenar, amontoar, ajuntar, cumular
    • 1938, Graciliano Ramos, “Mudança [A New Home]”, in Vidas Seccas [Barren Lives], Rio de Janeiro: Livraria José Olympio Editora, page 15:
      Olhou o ceo de novo. Os cirrus accumulavam-se, a lua surgiu, grande e branca. Certamente ia chover.
      He looked at the sky again. The cirruses clumped together, the moon came up, large and white. It was certainly going to rain.

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of acumular (See Appendix:Portuguese verbs)
Singular Plural
First-person
(eu) 		Second-person
(tu) 		Third-person
(ele / ela / você) 		First-person

Past participle

Feminine acumulada acumuladas
Indicative
Present acumulo acumulas acumula acumulamos acumulais acumulam
Imperfect acumulava acumulavas acumulava acumulávamos acumuláveis acumulavam
Preterite acumulei acumulaste acumulou acumulamos1, acumulámos2 acumulastes acumularam
Pluperfect acumulara acumularas acumulara acumuláramos acumuláreis acumularam
Future acumularei acumularás acumulará acumularemos acumulareis acumularão
Conditional acumularia acumularias acumularia acumularíamos acumularíeis acumulariam
Subjunctive
Present acumule acumules acumule acumulemos acumuleis acumulem
Imperfect acumulasse acumulasses acumulasse acumulássemos acumulásseis acumulassem
Future acumular acumulares acumular acumularmos acumulardes acumularem
Imperative
Affirmative acumula acumule acumulemos acumulai acumulem

1Brazilian Portuguese.
2European Portuguese.

Related terms

[edit]
  • acumulação
  • acumulador
  • acumulativo
  • acumulável
  • acúmulo

Further reading

[edit]
  • “acumular” in Dicionário Aberto based on Novo Diccionário da Língua Portuguesa de Cândido de Figueiredo, 1913

Spanish

[edit]

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • cumular (rare)

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin accumulāre (“accumulate”).

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /akumuˈlaɾ/ [a.ku.muˈlaɾ]
  • Audio (Colombia):(file)
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: a‧cu‧mu‧lar

Verb

[edit]

acumular (first-person singular present acumulo, first-person singular preterite acumulé, past participle acumulado)

  1. (transitive) to accumulate (to heap up in a mass)

Conjugation

[edit]

Derived terms

  • acumulable

Further reading

[edit]
  • “acumular”, in Diccionario de la lengua española [Dictionary of the Spanish Language] (in Spanish), online version 23.8, Royal Spanish Academy [Spanish: Real Academia Española], 10 December 2024

Venetan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin accumulāre (“accumulate”). Compare Italian accumulare.

Verb

[edit]

acumular

  1. (transitive) To accumulate, hoard or amass

Conjugation

[edit]

* Venetan conjugation varies from one region to another. Hence, the following conjugation should be considered as typical, not as exhaustive.

Conjugation of acumular (first conjugation)
infinitive acumular
auxiliary verb aver gerund acumulando
past participle acumulà
person singular plural
first second third first second third
indicative mi ti eło / eła noialtri / noialtre voialtri / voialtre łuri / łore
present acumulo (te) acumuli (el/ła) acumula acumulémo, acumulòn acumulé (i/łe) acumula
imperfect acumulava (te) acumulavi (el/ła) acumulava acumulàvimo acumulavi (i/łe) acumulava
future acumularò (te) acumularè (el/ła) acumularà acumularémo acumularè (i/łe) acumularà
conditional acumularìa (te) acumularisi (el/ła) acumularìa acumularìsimo acumularisi (i/łe) acumularìa
subjunctive che mi che ti che eło / eła che noialtri / noialtre che voialtri / voialtre che łuri / łore
present acumule, acumula (te) acumuli (el/ła) acumule, (el/ła) acumula acumulémo, acumulone acumulé (i/łe) acumule, (i/łe) acumula
imperfect acumulase (te) acumulasi (el/ła) acumulase acumulàsimo acumulasi (i/łe) acumulase
